solution_line_template: There are {houses_per_day}*{buy_percent}=<<{houses_per_day}*{buy_percent}={houses_buying_per_day}>>{houses_buying_per_day} houses buying from him per day
Of those {houses_buying_per_day}/2=<<{houses_buying_per_day}/2={buyers_per_type}>>{buyers_per_type} buy each type of knife set
So he gets {buyers_per_type}*{cheap_set_price}=$<<{buyers_per_type}*{cheap_set_price}={cheap_set_sales_per_day}>>{cheap_set_sales_per_day} per day from the cheap set
He also gets {buyers_per_type}*{expensive_set_price}=$<<{buyers_per_type}*{expensive_set_price}={expensive_set_sales_per_day}>>{expensive_set_sales_per_day} from the expensive set
So he makes a total of {cheap_set_sales_per_day}+{expensive_set_sales_per_day}=$<<{cheap_set_sales_per_day}+{expensive_set_sales_per_day}={total_sales_per_day}>>{total_sales_per_day} per day
